S5.T1.caption: Table 1: miniImageNet average few-shot classification accuracy
S5.T1.table:
Models Backbone miniImageNet 5-way
1 shot 5 shot
Fine-tune baseline ConvNet-4 28.86 ± 0.54%percent\% 49.79 ± 0.79%percent\%
Matching Networks [9] ConvNet-4 43.56 ± 0.84%percent\% 55.31 ± 0.73%percent\%
Meta-Learning LSTM [10] ConvNet-4 43.44 ± 0.77%percent\% 60.60 ± 0.71%percent\%
MAML [5] ConvNet-4 48.70 ± 1.84%percent\% 63.11 ± 0.92%percent\%
Prototypical Networks [17] ConvNet-4 49.42 ± 0.78%percent\% 68.20 ± 0.66%percent\%
Relation Networks [11] ConvNet-4 50.44 ± 0.82%percent\% 65.32 ± 0.70%percent\%
R2D2 [23] ConvNet-4 51.20 ± 0.60%percent\% 68.80 ± 0.10%percent\%
MetaOptNet [24] ConvNet-4 52.87 ± 0.57%percent\% 68.76 ± 0.48%percent\%
MAML+Meta-dropout [25] ConvNet-4 51.93 ± 0.67%percent\% 67.42 ± 0.52%percent\%
Negative Margin [26] ConvNet-4 52.84 ± 0.76%percent\% 70.41 ± 0.66%percent\%
Ours(Weight generator) ConvNet-4 52.89 ± 1.82%percent\% 65.95 ± 0.96%percent\%
Ours(Homoscedastic uncertainty) ConvNet-4 53.97 ± 1.80%percent\% 71.62 ± 0.43%percent\%
references: Training and evaluation: During meta-training, meta-testing, meta-validation, we sample 5-way 1-shot tasks from the corresponding classes and images. Every time we sampled five different classes, we randomly assigned index c∈\in[N] to each class. During meta-testing, we sampled 10,000 tasks. For each task, the query set contained 15 images per class. We report the results of our method on the miniImageNet and tieredImageNet datasets compared to previous work in Table 1 and Table 2, including the average few-shot classification accuracy (%percent\%) and 95%percent\% confidence interval.

Every time we sampled five different classes, we randomly assigned index c∈\in[N] to each class. During meta-testing, we sampled 10,000 tasks. For each task, the query set contained 15 images per class. We report the results of our method on the miniImageNet and tieredImageNet datasets compared to previous work in Table 1 and Table 2, including the average few-shot classification accuracy (%percent\%) and 95%percent\% confidence interval.
